div.p: Greetings. I have received nothing from Geneva; as soon as I receive anything, I will send it. Since a messenger conveniently presented himself to me here, who, although he is from Baden, has been known to me for many years, I am sending to you and to Mr. Gwalther each a Savoy cabbage through him, and I ask that you kindly accept these small gifts. I know I owe you more; but at present, nothing else occurs to me by which I can at least in some way testify to my gratitude to you. I will do so more liberally in the future, God willing. I also pray that the Lord grants you and all yours many, most prosperous, and happiest years. The same wishes are sent to you by Mr. Steiger, Graffenried, MÃ¼linen, my father-in-law, mother, and wife. May the Lord always keep you safe!
Johannes Haller, yours entirely and forever.
To the most distinguished men, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger and Rudolf Gwalther, the most faithful pastors of the Zurich church, my lords to be perpetually respected.
